page.title: 13Swimming Clubs in S.on A.
page.content: Stratford has two swimming Clubs which are both based at the Leisure Centre. The Avon Neptunes meet 7 times a week (Mon.7-8am,Tues.7-8am and 8-9pm,Weds.7 -8pm,Thurs.5-7pm,Fri.7-8pm,and Sat.12- 1pm). A member would not have to go to all the sessions but most attend at least two.Membership costs Â£10 per year and a further Â£5 per month for tuition.The Neptunes are a competitive club and attend many galas as well as organising ice skating,discos,and parties.The Amateur Swimming Club meets on a Friday from 6-7.30pm. The emphasis is upon training.There is a scheme of awards which leads to better swimming:Bronze,Silver,and Gold Endeavour Awards,Stage 1 and Stage 2, Bronze, Silver,and Gold Survival and then Life Saving.The last session is competitive and the team is known as The Barracudas.12 lessons cost Â£5.
